name: Webdesign-Ugurcu DHL Manager
author: Webdesign Ugurcu

sections.description:
This plugin enables a feature for you to print your DHL shipping labels directly from wordpress. If someone makes a order in your woocommerce shop, you can now create a DHL label at orderDetails
to ship your products. Very simple, with only one button to press at your orderDetails menu.

Translations

  • English – default, always included
  • German: Deutsch – immer dabei!
sections.installation:
1. Upload the plugin files to the /wp-content/plugins/wu-dhl directory, or install the plugin through the WordPress plugins screen directly.
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ screen in WordPress
  3. Use the Settings->DHL Manager screen to configure the plugin
  4. Configure all datas needed on the configuration screen
  5. Use the button in the Order Detail Screen
sections.faq:
Installation Instructions

  1. Upload the plugin files to the /wp-content/plugins/wu-dhl directory, or install the plugin through the WordPress plugins screen directly.
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ screen in WordPress
  3. Use the Settings->DHL Manager screen to configure the plugin
  4. Configure all datas needed on the configuration screen
  5. Use the button in the Order Detail Screen

Why can’t I print my label?

Check your configuration, one misspelled letter or wrong number would crash the connection to the DHL server.

Why is there the word MUSTER on my sample Print/Sandbox?

If you use a Sample print or a Sandbox print it is totaly free, but DHL only gives back a pattern of how it could look after being printed.

If I create a label can I delete it?

At the moment you can only delete it in your Database. There will come an update to fix this matter, so you can easily delete it per button click.

Why are there no retour labels?

We are already testing this feature, so we can update the plugin as soon as possible, so retour labels can be printed.

1.0.0
